document.discussion_title: WATCH: Top highlights from Day 6 at Rio Olympics | WWLP.com
document.topic_text: Click to share on Pinterest (Opens in new window) Day 5 in Rio saw Michael Phelps prove superhuman yet again. It saw Simone Biles sparkle on her way to gymnastics all-around gold, with Aly Raisman snagging silver. It saw Fiji win the country’s first-ever Olympic medal, a gold in the first-ever Olympic rugby sevens. It saw Kayla Harrison defend her judo title. It saw the first hole-in-one in Olympic history. And it saw a tie in the women’s 100m freestyle final, a race in which Simone Manuel become the first African-American woman to earn an individual swimming medal. Sound fun? It certainly was! Relive the day by watching all the top highlights below. Michael Phelps wins 4th consecutive 200m IM; Ryan Lochte doesn’t medal Simone Biles claims her rightful place atop the gymnastics world … … as teammate Aly Raisman shines for silver In return of Olympic golf, Justin Rose notches hole-in-one Fiji dominates men’s rugby sevens for first Olympic medal ever Kayla Harrison defends judo title by forcing last-second tapout Dalhausser/Lucena survive marathon beach volleyball match Simone Manuel, Penny Oleksiak tie for gold in 100m freestyle Ryan Murphy earns second backstroke gold of Games U.S. women’s field hockey, last in London, improves to 4-0 in Rio Ma Long smashes way to table tennis singles title New Zealand rowers, undefeated since 2009, win again Katie Ledecky breaks Olympic record in 800m freestyle prelim Share this:

It saw Simone Biles sparkle on her way to gymnastics all-around gold, with Aly Raisman snagging silver. It saw Fiji win the country’s first-ever Olympic medal, a gold in the first-ever Olympic rugby sevens. It saw Kayla Harrison defend her judo title. It saw the first hole-in-one in Olympic history. And it saw a tie in the women’s 100m freestyle final, a race in which Simone Manuel become the first African-American woman to earn an individual swimming medal. Sound fun? It certainly was! Relive the day by watching all the top highlights below.
